Pattern Library

Results

  • Notes
  • HTML
  • Info

When to use this component

The select component should only be used as a last resort in public-facing services because research shows that some users find selects very difficult to use.

How it works

The select component allows users to choose an option from a long list. Before using the select component, try asking users questions which will allow you to present them with fewer options.

Asking questions means you’re less likely to need to use the select component, and can consider using a different solution, such as radios.

<p>Box</p>

<div class="results_box results_box--blue">
    <h3>Lorem ipsum dolor sit</h3>
    <div class="results_text">00 years</div>
</div>

<p>Box explainer</p>
<div class="results_box results_box--red">
    <h3>Lorem ipsum dolor sit</h3>
    <div class="results_text--sml">00 years</div>
    <p>Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetuer adipiscing elit, sed diam nonummy nibh euismod tincidunt ut laoreet dolore magna aliquam erat volutpat. Ut wisi enim ad </p>
</div>

<p>Box outline</p>
<div class="results_box results_box--outline">
    <h3>In total, you will pay</h3>
    <div class="results_text--outline">£00.00</div>
</div>
